timeline.bodyText: you can use an AtomicBoolean for this, and it reads a little bit cleaner.
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: I'd use the word "export" in here, rather than "Process"
timeline.author: jkwatson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -52,6 +52,14 @@
    */
   ResultCode export(Collection<MetricData> metrics);
 
+  /**
+   * Processes the collection of {@link MetricData} that have not yet been processed.

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/export/MetricExporter.java b/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/export/MetricExporter.java
index b4501b4e4..f04d80a8b 100644
--- a/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/export/MetricExporter.java
+++ b/sdk/src/main/java/io/opentelemetry/sdk/metrics/export/MetricExporter.java

@@ -53,7 +53,7 @@ public interface MetricExporter {
   ResultCode export(Collection<MetricData> metrics);
 
   /**
-   * Processes the collection of {@link MetricData} that have not yet been processed.
+   * Exports the collection of {@link MetricData} that have not yet been exported.
    *
    * @return the result of the flush.
    * @since 0.4.0

timeline.bodyText: Same comment about using the word "Export", rather than "Process"
timeline.author: jkwatson
